title: Showery conditions expected to enhance from today
byline: Showery conditions are expected to enhance in Northern, Northcentral, Central, Uva and Eastern provinces in next few days from today (17), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Debate on Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill to be held today
byline: The debate on the second reading of the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill is scheduled to be held today (17).

title: Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning actor and ‘Godfather’ mainstay, dead at 95
byline: Robert Duvall, the Oscar-winning actor of matchless versatility and dedication whose classic roles included the intrepid consigliere of the first two “Godfather” movies and the over-the-hill country music singer in “Tender Mercies,” has died at age 95.

title: 2025 O/L examination to commence today
byline: The 2025 G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination is scheduled to commence today (17).

title: UK Deputy PM David Lammy to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: The Deputy Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, David Lammy is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka today (17).

title: 58-year-old passenger arrested with foreign cigarettes at BIA
byline: A 58-year-old man has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a stock of foreign cigarettes into the country.

title: Foreign national killed in wild elephant attack in Sigiriya
byline: A foreign national has reportedly died after being attacked by a wild elephant on the Sigiriya-Pidurangala road.

title: President Anura Kumara to attend India–AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to leave for India today (17) to attend the India AI Impact Summit 2026 in Delhi.

title: Trump says he will be involved indirectly in Iran talks
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that he would be involved “indirectly” in high-stakes talks between Iran and the U.S. over Tehran’s nuclear program set for Tuesday in Geneva, adding he believed Tehran wanted to make a deal.

title: 3 killed, including suspect, in shooting at hockey rink in Rhode Island: police
byline: Three people, including the suspect, were fatally shot during a Rhode Island youth hockey game Monday, authorities said.

title: Man charged with terrorism offences over Taylor Swift concert attack plot
byline: A man has been charged with terrorism-related offences over a plot to carry out an attack at a Taylor Swift concert in 2024.

title: UK Deputy PM David Lammy arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The Deputy Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, David Lammy has arrived in Sri Lanka, a short while ago.

title: Harsha urges IMF to support governance alongside financial assistance
byline: The Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (CoPF), MP Dr. Harsha de Silva, extended a warm welcome to IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva during her visit to Sri Lanka, while expressing appreciation for the support provided by the IMF when the country faced a financial crisis.

title: Two suspects arrested with ‘Ice’ and heroin in Wellampitiya and Mattakkuliya
byline: A suspect has been arrested with 50 grams and 960 milligrams of the drug Crystal Methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’) in the Kotuwila area of Wellampitiya.

title: SLTB employee integration to be based strictly on merit and experience – Dy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways Prasanna Gunasena has announced that all future employee integration at the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) will be carried out strictly based on qualifications and professional experience.

title: Man attacked to death in Kopay; Two suspects arrested
byline: A 59-year-old man has been attacked to death using a mammoty in the Alliyawatta area of Kopay.

title: SC rules no formal determination needed on “Protection of Occupants” and “Rent Repeal” bills
byline: The Supreme Court has decided that there is no necessity to make a formal determination regarding the bills titled “Protection of Occupants” and “Rent Repeal”, which had been challenged under Article 121.1 of the Constitution, Speaker of the House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne stated in Parliament today (17).

title: Poor sleep and ‘social jet lag’ hit Japanese economic productivity, study finds
byline: Japan suffers an estimated annual economic loss of around ¥1 trillion due to the “social jet lag” mismatch between sleep patterns on weekdays and holidays, according to a recent study.

title: Bangladesh’s newly elected MPs take oath
byline: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Chairman Tarique Rahman, along with other lawmakers from his party, took oath as Members of Parliament today morning (17) following the February 12 parliamentary elections.

title: Former Minister Vijith Wijayamuni Soysa arrives at FCID
byline: Former Minister Vijith Wijayamuni Soysa has arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today (17).

title: US and Iran set for high-stakes nuclear talks in Geneva as threat of war looms
byline: The U.S. and Iran hold indirect talks in Geneva on Tuesday aimed at resolving their long-running nuclear dispute, with little clear indication of compromise as Washington masses a battle force in the region.

title: Apartment building fire in Spain’s Catalonia kills 5 youths
byline: Five people have died and four others suffered minor injuries in a fire at an apartment building in Spain’s northeastern Catalonia, regional firefighters said late on Monday.

title: Interim injunction issued preventing SLFP from suspending Dayasiri’s party membership
byline: The Colombo District Court issued an interim injunction today preventing the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) from implementing its decision to suspend the party membership of Member of Parliament Dayasiri Jayasekera.

title: Akuregoda shooting not within a high security zone - Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala stated that the area in Akuregoda, where Attorney-at-Law Buddhika Mallawaarachchi and his wife were recently shot and killed, is not a High Security Zone.

title: Suspected vehicle used in Akuregoda double murder examined by forensic officers
byline: Government Analyst’s Department officers this morning (17) examined the car which had been set on fire in the Agaliya area of Baddegama, Galle, and which is suspected to have been used by the suspects involved in the Akuregoda double homicide.

title: Sri Lanka, Japan sign Economic Cooperation Agreement to boost economic relations
byline: Charting a new path for economic relations between Sri Lanka and Japan, the Sri Lanka–Japan Intergovernmental Economic Policy Dialogue was held successfully.

title: Night Mail train derails after colliding with elephant
byline: The No. 943 Night Mail train, traveling from Colombo to Trincomalee, derailed early this morning (17) near the 151st milepost in Kitulutuwa after colliding with a wild elephant.

title: Dilith demands clarity on Govt.’s remarks over eradicating racism from Sri Lanka
byline: The assertion made by the government faction on eradicating racism from Sri Lanka is damaging the image of the entire country, since Sri Lankans in general are not racist in nature, the leader of the Sarvajana Balaya, Parliamentarian Dilith Jayaweera stated.

title: Police officers accused of failing to prevent Jinthupitiya shooting granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court ordered the release on bail of a Police Sergeant and a Constable who were produced before court for allegedly failing to prevent a recent shooting incident in the Jinthupitiya area.

title: Colombo HC sentences ‘IDH Sudda’ and woman to life imprisonment for drug trafficking
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced Samantha Kumara Perera, alias “IDH Sudda”, a high-profile underworld operative and Prabhakaran Priyadarshani to life imprisonment.

title: JICA yet to grant final approval for Light Rail Transit project - Minister
byline: The Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) has not yet granted final approval for the proposed Light Rail Transit (LRT) project in Colombo, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath stated.

title: Sri Lanka–Japan export-industrial corridor mooted during high-profile meeting
byline: A high-level Japanese delegation paid a courtesy call on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (17) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Two brothers arrested over Akuregoda double murder to be produced before court
byline: The two brothers who were arrested in connection with the shooting and killing of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda are scheduled to be produced before the Kaduwela Magistrate’s Court today (17).

title: President Anura Kumara leaves for India
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has left the island for India to attend the AI Impact Summit 2026 in Delhi.

title: Militants kill 11 Pakistani security personnel, one child near Afghan border, army says
byline: Eleven security forces personnel and one child were killed in a militant attack in Pakistan’s northwestern region of Bajaur, the military said on Tuesday.

title: Court grants permission to detain and question two brothers arrested over Akuregoda double murder
byline: The Kaduwela Magistrate’s Court has granted permission to police to detain and question the two brothers arrested in connection with the Akuregoda double murder, until tomorrow (18).

title: ‘Amber’ weather advisory issued, showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for heavy rain in the Eastern and Uva provinces and Polonnaruwa, Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts.

title: Tarique Rahman sworn in as Bangladesh’s PM after landslide election victory
byline: Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader Tarique Rahman was sworn in as Bangladesh’s prime minister on Tuesday, marking a decisive political shift in the South Asian nation after his party’s sweeping parliamentary election victory.

title: Traffic congestion reported due to protest stage by Colombo University students
byline: A protest march organized by students of the University of Colombo, based on several demands, has caused severe traffic congestion in the vicinity of the Colombo University today (17).

title: Speaker endorses certificate on Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill
byline: The Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill was passed in Parliament today (17) with a majority of 152 votes.

title: Acting Registrar of Births and Deaths arrested for accepting bribe
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested an Acting Registrar of Births and Deaths attached to the Alayadiwembu Divisional Secretariat for allegedly soliciting and accepting a bribe in connection with the registration of a birth certificate.

title: Australia knocked out of T20 World Cup following Zimbabwe-Ireland washout in Pallekele
byline: Australia was knocked out of the T20 World Cup 2026 tournament after the group-stage match between Ireland and Zimbabwe was washed out on Tuesday in Pallekele.

title: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader and US presidential hopeful, dies at 84
byline: Charismatic U.S. civil rights leader Jesse Jackson, an eloquent Baptist minister raised in the segregated South who became a close associate of Martin Luther King Jr and twice ran for the Democratic presidential nomination, has died at age 84, his family said in a statement on Tuesday.

title: Another suspect linked to Akuregoda shooting arrested
byline: Another individual suspected to have transported the weapons used in the killing of the lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda on February 13 has been arrested this evening (17), police stated.

title: Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill passed
byline: The Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill has been passed in Parliament without amendments.

title: Second reading of Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill passed
byline: The second reading of the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill has been passed in Parliament.

title: IMF Chief visits cyclone-affected areas
byline: The Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Kristalina Georgieva commenced her official engagements in Sri Lanka with field visits to areas affected by Cyclone Ditwah, inspecting damage and interacting with impacted communities as part of efforts to support recovery and long-term resilience.

title: Locomotive operators to launch a strike at midnight
byline: A group of Sri Lanka Railway locomotive operators have announced they will launch a strike from midnight today (17).

title: IMF Chief Kristalina Georgieva meets President Anura Kumara Dissanayake
byline: The Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Kristalina Georgieva, has met with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (17).

title: India tells global tech platforms to follow constitution after tougher content rules
byline: India’s information minister said on Tuesday that big tech platforms like Google’s YouTube, Meta, X and Netflix must operate within the country’s constitutional framework, a week after New Delhi tightened its content-takedown rules.

title: Monk arrested for fraudulently collecting money using two Ministers’ photos
byline: A monk has been arrested today (17) for allegedly collecting money by creating fake WhatsApp accounts using the photographs of Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody and Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Anura Karunathilaka.

title: President Anura Kumara holds talks with visiting UK Deputy PM David Lammy
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasised the visit of the United Kingdom’s Deputy Prime Minister, David Lammy, as timely and significant, noting that it helps reinforce international confidence in Sri Lanka’s recovery and underlines the importance of the visit at this juncture.

title: Health Minister calls on new Bangladesh PM
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has paid a courtesy call on newly elected Prime Minister of Bangladesh Tarique Rahman in Dhaka.

title: President Anura Kumara begins India visit
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who departed Sri Lanka to attend the AI Impact Summit 2026 at the special invitation of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, arrived at the Indira Gandhi International Airport, New Delhi, this afternoon (17).
